trial_identification.studytitle: The effects of daily passive movements on ankle mobility in people with spinal cord injury.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effects of daily passive movements on ankle mobility in people with spinal cord injury.

interventions.interventions: The experimental ankle of each subject will receive 20 minutes of passive movements, five days a week for 6 months.
interventions.comparator: The control ankle of each subject will receive no passive movements

primaryOutcome.outcome: Passive ankle range of motion with the application of 17Nm one day.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at the beginning and one-day after the 6 month intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Passive ankle range of motion with the application of 12Nm.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: This will be measured at the beginning and one-day after the 6 month intervention.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1. have sustained a spinal cord injury2. have grade 1/5 strength or less around both knees and ankles3. have at least 15 degrees movement in both ankles4. have signs of ankle stiffness.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Subjects will be excluded if:1. their carers are unable to provide intervention2. they ambulate.

trial_design.concealment: Following initial assessment one ankle of each subject will be randomly assigned to the experimental group. The other ankle of each subject will be assigned to the control group. The allocation schedule will be generated prior to the study by a person not otherwise involved in the study. The allocation schedule of each subject will be concealed in sequentially numbered envelopes. Subjects will be considered to have entered the study once their envelope is opened.
trial_design.designfeatures: within-subject design. That is, one ankle of each subject will be randomly allocated to the treatment group. The other ankle will be allocated to the control group. All assessors will be blinded.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: A randomised within-subjects design will be used to determine the effect of regular passive movements on the ankle. One ankle of each subject will receive 20 minutes of passive movements, five days a week for 6 months. The other ankle will not receive passive movements. The primary outcome measure is passive ankle dorsiflexion with the application of 17Nm torque. All measurements will be taken by blinded assessors.
ethicsAndSummary.publication:
